  • Method Details

    • verifyElementTextIsEmpty

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*?)( is not)?(?: is)? empty?$") public static void verifyElementTextIsEmpty(String elementName, String assertion)
      Verifies the element has text by asserting item contains text

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the title header is not empty
      • I verify the textbox is empty
      • I verify the Provider dropdown is not empty
      Parameters:
      elementName - String name of the element to verify.
      assertion - Sting if this is not empty, we expect it to be true.

    • verifyElementTextContains

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?)( does not)? (has|have|contains?) the text \"([^\"]*)\"$") public static void verifyElementTextContains(String elementName, String assertion, String matchType, String text)
      Used to verify that an element contains certain text. It takes an element name and then an optional "does not", which if present means that the method will look for the text to not exist. Then it will look for the words has|have to do an exact match or contain(s) to do a partial match. It uses the text contained in double quotes for matching.

      NOTE: If "URL" (without the quotes) is passed in all caps in place of the element name, This step will check for the text to exist in the current page URL.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the header div contains the text "Header"
      • I verify the state dropdown does not contain the text "VA"
      • I verify the paragraph div has the text "This is my example text."
      • I verify the street name textbox does not have the text "P.O. Box"
      • I verify the url http://google.com has the text "google"
      Parameters:
      elementName - String The name of the element to be evaluated as defined in the page object.
      assertion - String Evaluated as a boolean, where null = false and any text = true.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      text - String The text to verify exists in the element.

    • waitUntilElementTextContainsStored

      @Then("^I wait until the (.*?)( does not)? contains? the text (?:entered|used) (?:for|in) the (.*?)$") public static void waitUntilElementTextContainsStored(String elementName, String assertion, String key)

      Waits until we can verify that an element contains text stored previously. Such as by steps that randomly append/prepend to text.

      Gherkin Examples:
      • I wait until the Last Name Field contains the text entered for the Last Name Field
      • I wait until the Username Display contains the text used in the User Name Input Field
      • I wait until the Last Name Field does not contain the text entered for the First Name Field
      Parameters:
      elementName - String The name of the element to be evaluated as defined in the page object.
      assertion - String whether or not we expect a match or mismatch
      key - String the storage key for the previously stored text to check for

    • waitUntilElementTextContains

      @Then("^I wait until the (.*?)( does not)? contains? the text \"([^\"]*)\"$") public static void waitUntilElementTextContains(String elementName, String assertion, String text)
      Waits until we can verify that an element contains certain text. It uses the text contained in double quotes for matching. If the condition is not true, it will wait until the timeout for it to become true, such as if the text on an element changes. Gherkin Examples:
      • I wait until the header div contains the text "Header"
      • I wait until the project details does not contain the text "Loading"
      • I wait until the titles contain the text "New"
      Parameters:
      elementName - String The name of the element to be evaluated as defined in the page object.
      text - String The text to verify exists in the element.

    • verifyURLTextContains

      private static void verifyURLTextContains(String text)
      Helper function for i_verify_the_element_contains_the_text() for checking text in the URL.
      Parameters:
      text - String text to verify in the URL

    • verifySelectionTextContains

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?)( does not)? (?:has|have) the text \"([^\"]*)\" selected$") public static void verifySelectionTextContains(String elementName, String assertion, String textToMatch)
      Used to verify that the selected option of a select element contains certain text. It takes an element name and then an optional "does not", which if present means that the method will look for the text to not exist. Then it will look for any of the words has|have and uses the text contained in double quotes for matching.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the City Dropdown has the text "New York" selected
      • I verify the Area Select Box has the text "This is my example text." selected
      • I verify the cola radio button does not have the text "Root beer" selected
      Parameters:
      elementName - String Name of the Element to verify
      assertion - String if empty we expect this to be false
      textToMatch - String Text to match

    • verifySelectionTextContainsStoredValue

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?)( does not)? (?:has|have) the value (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*?)$") public static void verifySelectionTextContainsStoredValue(String elementName, String assertion, String key)
      Used to verify that the selected option of a select element contains the text used in an element. It takes an element name and then an optional "does not", which if present means that the method will look for the text to not exist. Then it will look up the value set for the second element. This second element may be the same element or a different one. For example, you might select the first item in a drop down and not know what you selected. Using this method, you can check to make sure that the value appears correctly. Alternately, you might enter a value in a text box and want to verify that it was programmatically selected in a drop down.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the City Dropdown has the value selected for the City Dropdown
      • I verify the City Dropdown has the value entered for the City Field
      • I verify the Shipping City Dropdown does not have the value used for the Billing City Dropdown
      Parameters:
      elementName - String Name of the Element to verify
      assertion - String if empty we expect this to be false
      key - String the key to retrieve the text to match from the configuration manager

    • toolTipText

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) tooltip( does not)? (?:has|have) the value \"([^\"]*)\"$") public static void toolTipText(String elementName, String assertion, String textToMatch)
      Used to verify that on mouse over an element contains certain text. Gherkin Examples:
      • I verify the mouse over tooltip has the value "Username"
      • I verify the save tooltip has the value "Click to Save"
      • I verify the compare button tooltip does not have the value "Please Wait..."
      Parameters:
      elementName - String The name of the element to be evaluated as defined in the page object.
      assertion - String Evaluated as a boolean, where null = false and any text = true.
      textToMatch - String The text to verify exists in the element.
